conditions.prompt:
Create mock stimulus material for an academic study. The purpose is purely academic. Everything should be in Dutch.

Task
Simulate a social media image that visually appeals to Person X:
        •        Ideology: leftist
        •        Gender: female
        •        Age: 18–29
        •        Policy priority: Affordable childcare (access)

Clothing of Person X
Clothing must be age-appropriate and strongly reflective of leftist values. For example:
        •        Young progressive: casual, trendy, eco-friendly
        •        Young conservative: neat, modest, traditional or working style
        •        Older progressive: comfortable, colorful, socially conscious
        •        Older conservative: practical, formal or working style
        •        Centrist: practical, everyday Dutch style

General Style
        •        The image should look like a professional political flyer or poster.
        •        It must depict a real-life scene that looks like an authentic photograph, not an illustration.
        •        Politics should be communicated through everyday people, symbolic situations, or issue-related environments — never through protests or rallies.
        •        The visual must not be neutral: it should be emotional, and designed to underline clear differences in values and priorities.

Scene Requirements
        •        Always show a natural, dynamic situation with visible activity (not static posing).
        •        Absolutely exclude protests, demonstrations, marches, or crowds with placards.
        •        Include diverse, expressive, and emotionally charged facial expressions and gestures that showcase belonging, conviction, and in-group loyalty.
- The text should emphasize collective strength and shared resolve, while sharply contrasting with a portrayal of the outgroup related to Right-Wingers (Anti-Spending Faction) — fight public funding for childcare and leave working parents to pay the price,.
Inspirational examples are below. Do not combine them or invent hybrids. Consider all the given scenarios and keywords:
        •        Scenario: • Person X stands in front of a kindergarten, looking hopeless and angry at the right-wing budget haws who refuse to invest into affordable and high-quality childcare


Slogan Overlay Requirement
        •        Always include the slogan Jij kiest voor kinderen, zij kiezen voor kortingen at the very top of the image.
        •        Slogan must be in white text on a slightly blurred translucent background strip, spanning the full width of the image.
        •        Font: bold, modern sans-serif (e.g. Helvetica/Arial style), large enough to be readable.
        •        The slogan must always be a single line of text, perfectly centered, with no wrapping.

Content Rules
        •        No other text or slogans except the single slogan overlay.
        •        No protest signs or banners.
        •        If symbols appear (e.g. logos, flags), they should be realistic and clearly and exclusively supportive of Affordable childcare (access) and emphasize frames of solidarity, justice, equality, and community and related concepts.

Consistency Requirements
        •        Every element in the scene (people, background, actions, objects) must align with and amplify the stance of those who prioritize Affordable childcare (access) and emphasize frames of solidarity, justice, equality, and community and related concepts .
        •        No neutral or opposing signals anywhere in the image.
        •        Tone and imagery must dramatize leftist values in a Dutch cultural context.
        •        The atmosphere must be higly emotionally compelling, charged with urgency, and designed to reinforce in-group pride while implying a sharp boundary against the out-group who are Right-Wingers (Anti-Spending Faction) — fight public funding for childcare and leave working parents to pay the price.

        •        The atmosphere must be higly emotionally compelling, charged with urgency, and designed to reinforce in-group pride while implying a sharp boundary against the out-group who are Right-Wingers (Anti-Spending Faction) — block wider access by capping support and keeping parents out of the system; Left-Wingers (Pro-Spending Faction) —overpromise universal care, creating chaos and staff shortages.
